parser_tools module

Created on Fri Jun 24 15:31:53 2022

This module includes tools for analysing strings.

@author: Ketil

parser_tools.any_digits(string)

Returns True if string contains any digits. Returns False if string contains no digits.

Parameters

string (str) – Some string.

Returns

True if string contains digits, False if string contains no digits.

Return type

bool

parser_tools.strornum(string)

Converts a string to integer or float. If the string is neither, return the string.

Parameters

string (str) – String containing some numerical value. If the string is not either an int or a float, return the pure string.

Returns

Either an integer, float or a string.

Return type

int, float or str

parser_tools.strtoBool(string)

Returns a Boolean based on the string input. If string = ‘True’ then it returns True. If string = ‘False’ then it returns False.

Parameters

string (str) – String containing either ‘True’ or ‘False’

Returns

True or False

Return type

bool

parser_tools.strtolist(string, dtype=<class 'str'>)

Construct a list out of a comma separated string. Blank spaces are removed between elements. Set the type of input to be str, int, float etc.

Parameters

  • string (str) – String to be parsed into a list.

  • dtype (dtype, optional) – Type of each element of list, by default str.

Returns

List of elements separated by comma in original string.

Return type

list
